page.title: 17Customs
page.content:
Camblesforth Feast
Camblesforth Feast was held annually. Every year a girl from our school was chosen to be the Queen together with some attendants. The Feast was held on the school field. There was quite a variety of activities including floats, stalls and games, sports and refreshments, and entertainments. There was a welly throwing competition, pony rides and races. The Feast always started with a procession of floats through the village led by a band. Children processed in fancy dress and there was a competition. Camblesforth Feast has not been held for the last two years because of lack of support.
